alert.note: Alert for Ellis (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:29AM CDT until July 07 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WASHITA...SOUTHEASTERN ELLIS...EASTERN ROGER MILLS...CUSTER...BLAINE...DEWEY...SOUTHWESTERN MAJOR...NORTHEASTERN BECKHAM AND SOUTHEASTERN WOODWARD COUNTIES... At 529 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles north of Chester to 7 miles southeast of Taloga to 6 miles west of Moorewood, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Elk City, Weatherford, Clinton, Watonga, Fairview, Taloga, Burns Flat, Geary, Mooreland, Thomas, Hydro, Seiling, Arapaho, Canton, Hammon, Canute, Leedey, Custer City, Butler, and Longdale. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
